title: About
text:
Hello!
I’m currently a student at Univserity of California, Santa Barbara and I have loved my time here. I’ve lived by the beach for most of my life and living in Goleta has been the best place to find so many opportunities to follow my professional and personal passions.
 


Hiking
I really love hiking, and it’s usually for the purpose of getting outside and eating lunch in a much cooler spot.



Sunrise hike in Southern California





Southern California hike with some friends





Sunrise hike with my NPS interns




Chasing the Snow
One of the only things I can’t get on the coast of southern California is snow. I have found some of my absolute favorite spots around Mammoth and Mono County, where I also love to snowboard as much as I can.



McLeod Lake in the spring





Convict lake in early spring





Friend trip to enjoy fresh snow





View on a snowboarding trip




Shi
And finally, my two favorite pictures of my brother’s dog. She is the cutest thing in the world and who doesn’t like dog pictures.



Shi playing in the snow





Shi very oddly playing in the snow

title: Jessi Rumkin
text:
Hello! My name is Jessica Rumkin, but I often go by Jessi.
This is my personal website that I built; here you will find information about me and my profession and academic experience. Check out the Projects page to see a wide variety of experiences, the GitHub link to see the code for this site, or the About page to see some really pretty hiking photos.

I’m currently studying at University fo California, Santa Barbara (UCSB) for a BS in Environmental Studies with an additional emphasis on Geographic Spatial Science. I will be finishing my degree at Utrecht University in the Netherlands next fall focusing on restoration and agroecology innovation.
At my current position as Growing Grounds Coordinator for a UCSB club and non-profit called Your Children’s Trees I co-manage a nursery of 350+ trees, mostly Coast Live oak, for local urban reforestation and ecosystem restoration. I also manage weekly events to delegate, teach, and supervise up to 15 volunteers to maximize their learning and completion of tasks.
Please see the contact links for all the ways to reach me!

title: Bren Environmental Studies Fellowship
text: A description of what I’ve done and learned from the fellowship.

title: Personal Data Project
text: A project for UCSB ENV S 193DS, I collected data on my study habits. For this course, I practiced data collection best practices, analyzed data, used statistical techniques to measure effects, and created data visualizations that properly represent findings and data biases.
